meanings.definition: Relating to biology or living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biological process of photosynthesis is essential for plants to make food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the biological characteristics of different species to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the penguins were having a biological meeting to discuss their swimming techniques.
meanings.sent4: Her love for animals was so deep, it was almost biological in nature.
meanings.sent5: The biological diversity of the rainforest is a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the science of biology.
meanings.sent1: In school, we learn about the biological processes that occur in living organisms.
meanings.sent2: The biological experiments conducted in the lab helped advance medical research.
meanings.sent3: The students found it amusing when the teacher referred to the biology textbook as a biological treasure map.
meanings.sent4: The complexity of the human body is a testament to the wonders of biological science.
meanings.sent5: The microscope revealed a whole new world of biological wonders.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biological field trip to the forest allowed students to observe various plants and animals.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use biological samples to analyze the effects of pollution on marine life.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his attempt to understand cats' behavior was a failed biological expedition.
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with insects led her to embark on a biological adventure in the Amazon rainforest.
meanings.sent5: The biological investigation into the mysterious disease yielded surprising results.
